body_html:
Yes, I have it already installed in /usr/local/cuda/lib64
…
On Thu, Jan 26, 2017, 00:49 Adam Paszke ***@***.***> wrote: Huh, seems that it's a dynamic loader issue. Some people had the same problem with TensorFlow (see tensorflow/tensorflow#6744 <tensorflow/tensorflow#6744>). It's probably some shared memory issue like too many open references or shm files. I don't think we can debug that without a good repro, and unfortunately you seem to be the only one suffering from that 😕 Can you try removing all torch-related packages, reinstalling them, and rebooting your system? Also, do you have cuDNN installed somewhere? We're including it in our binaries, but maybe you have it in some cuda dirs. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#585 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJLb6ltt6IKww-uzBrt51vnPAclk_BUpks5rV6BDgaJpZM4LtHV_> .
body_text:
Yes, I have it already installed in /usr/local/cuda/lib64
…
On Thu, Jan 26, 2017, 00:49 Adam Paszke ***@***.***> wrote:
 Huh, seems that it's a dynamic loader issue. Some people had the same
 problem with TensorFlow (see tensorflow/tensorflow#6744
 <tensorflow/tensorflow#6744>). It's probably
 some shared memory issue like too many open references or shm files. I
 don't think we can debug that without a good repro, and unfortunately you
 seem to be the only one suffering from that 😕

 Can you try removing all torch-related packages, reinstalling them, and
 rebooting your system? Also, do you have cuDNN installed somewhere? We're
 including it in our binaries, but maybe you have it in some cuda dirs.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#585 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJLb6ltt6IKww-uzBrt51vnPAclk_BUpks5rV6BDgaJpZM4LtHV_>

body:
Yes, I have it already installed in /usr/local/cuda/lib64

On Thu, Jan 26, 2017, 00:49 Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Huh, seems that it's a dynamic loader issue. Some people had the same
> problem with TensorFlow (see tensorflow/tensorflow#6744
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6744>). It's probably
> some shared memory issue like too many open references or shm files. I
> don't think we can debug that without a good repro, and unfortunately you
> seem to be the only one suffering from that 😕
>
> Can you try removing all torch-related packages, reinstalling them, and
> rebooting your system? Also, do you have cuDNN installed somewhere? We're
> including it in our binaries, but maybe you have it in some cuda dirs.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/585#issuecomment-275205199>,
> or mute the thread
